intro: Lachnostylis, commonly known as the golden lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers. The plants typically grow as terrestrial orchids with erect stems and showy inflorescences. Lachnostylis species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Their botanical significance lies in their unique floral structure and ecological role in their native habitats.
